summary.en: “overidden” is not standard; the correct form is “overridden,” meaning changed or rejected by higher authority/priority (past participle of override).
summary.zh: “overidden”不是标准拼写；正确写法是“overridden”，表示被更高权限/优先级所覆盖、否决或取代（override 的过去分词）。

definition.en: A common misspelling of “overridden,” the past participle of “override.”
definition.zh: “overridden”的常见拼写错误；“override”的过去分词。

examples.en: It should be “overridden,” not “overidden.”
examples.zh: 应该写“overridden”，不是“overidden”。

examples.en: The system setting was overridden by an administrator.
examples.zh: 系统设置被管理员覆盖/强制更改了。

definition.en: (overridden) Changed or replaced by something with higher authority or priority.
definition.zh: （overridden）被更高权限或更高优先级的内容所更改或取代。

examples.en: The default rules were overridden by new company policies.
examples.zh: 默认规则被公司的新政策取代了。

examples.en: Her decision was overridden by the manager.
examples.zh: 她的决定被经理否决/推翻了。

definition.en: (overridden) Past participle of “override”: to use authority to reject a decision or to take control instead of an existing control.
definition.zh: （overridden）“override”的过去分词：指用权力否决决定，或用新的控制取代原有控制。

examples.en: The judge’s ruling was overridden by a higher court.
examples.zh: 法官的裁决被上级法院推翻了。

examples.en: Manual control has overridden the automatic mode.
examples.zh: 手动控制已取代自动模式。

extraExplanation: “override”的拼写要注意：中间是“rr”，结尾是“ridden”（类似 ride → ridden）。很多人会误写成 overidden。
在计算机/系统语境中，override 常译为“覆盖”“强制执行”“优先于”；在权力/决策语境中常译为“否决”“推翻”。

summary.en: Overidealism means having idealistic beliefs or expectations to an unrealistic degree.
summary.zh: overidealism 指“过度理想主义”，即理想或期待过于完美而不切实际。

definition.en: Excessive idealism; the tendency to have unrealistically perfect expectations about people, life, or plans.
definition.zh: 过度理想主义；对人、生活或计划抱有不切实际的完美期待。

examples.en: Her overidealism made every small mistake feel like a disaster.
examples.zh: 她的过度理想主义让每个小错误都像一场灾难。

examples.en: Overidealism can be inspiring at first, but it may lead to disappointment later.
examples.zh: 过度理想主义起初可能很鼓舞人心，但之后也可能带来失望。

examples.en: The novel critiques political overidealism by showing how good intentions can fail in reality.
examples.zh: 这部小说通过展现善意如何在现实中受挫，批判了政治上的过度理想主义。

extraExplanation: 构词理解：over- 表示“过度、超过”，idealism 表示“理想主义”。合在一起就是“理想化得过头”。
语用提示：这个词不算非常常见，日常表达中也常用 overly idealistic（过于理想化的）或 unrealistic idealism（不切实际的理想主义）来替代。

summary.en: Overly idealistic; not practical enough for real-world conditions.
summary.zh: 过于理想化；缺乏现实可行性。

definition.en: Having overly high hopes or beliefs about how good, fair, or successful something will be, without enough attention to real-world limits or practical details.
definition.zh: 过于理想化的；不切实际地乐观的（对现实限制与细节考虑不足）。

examples.en: The plan sounded exciting, but it was overidealistic and ignored the budget.
examples.zh: 这个计划听起来很激动人心，但太过理想化，忽视了预算。

examples.en: She was overidealistic about changing the company culture in one month.
examples.zh: 她过于理想化地认为能在一个月内改变公司的文化。

extraExplanation: “overidealistic”通常带有批评或提醒的语气，表示“理想很美，但不够务实”。如果想更中性，可以说“idealistic”或“optimistic”；如果想强调“有愿景但也考虑现实”，可以说“idealistic but pragmatic（理想但务实）”。
构词上是 over-（过度）+ idealistic（理想主义的）。在写作中常用来评价计划、政策、期待等，暗示需要更多可行性分析。

summary.en: “Overidealize” means to idealize too much and ignore real flaws.
summary.zh: “overidealize”指把人或事过度理想化，忽视真实的缺点与复杂性。

definition.en: To see someone or something as much better or more perfect than they really are; to idealize too much.
definition.zh: 把某人或某事看得过于完美；过度理想化。

examples.en: It’s easy to overidealize a new relationship at the beginning.
examples.zh: 一段新关系刚开始时很容易被过度理想化。

examples.en: Don’t overidealize your hero—everyone has flaws.
examples.zh: 别把你的偶像过度理想化——每个人都有缺点。

examples.en: She overidealized life abroad and felt disappointed when reality was harder.
examples.zh: 她把国外生活过度理想化，现实更艰难时就感到失望。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、太……”。因此 overidealize = idealize（理想化）+ over（过度）。常见类似结构：overestimate（高估）、overreact（反应过度）、overthink（想太多）。
这个词常用于提醒别人把人、关系、工作或某种生活方式想得太美，从而忽略真实的复杂性与缺点。

summary.en: Overidealized means portrayed or believed to be too perfect and not realistic.
summary.zh: overidealized 指把事物看得或写得过于完美，以致不真实、脱离现实。

definition.en: Seen or described as too perfect, unrealistically positive, or lacking flaws (more idealized than is reasonable).
definition.zh: 被描写或看待得过于完美、过分正面，到了不现实、忽略缺点的程度。

examples.en: The movie gives an overidealized picture of small-town life.
examples.zh: 这部电影把小镇生活描绘得过于理想化。

examples.en: Her childhood memories felt overidealized once she heard her siblings’ stories.
examples.zh: 当她听到兄弟姐妹的说法后，她的童年回忆显得过分理想化。

examples.en: The proposal was criticized for its overidealized assumptions about human behavior.
examples.zh: 这份提案因对人类行为的假设过于理想化而受到批评。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、超过合理程度”；“idealize”表示“把……理想化”。因此 overidealized 常用来提醒：某种描述或期待不够贴近现实。
常见搭配：an overidealized view/image/portrait of…（对……过分理想化的看法/形象/描绘）；overidealized assumptions（过度理想化的假设）。

summary.en: “Overidealizes” means “idealizes too much,” seeing someone or something as more perfect than reality.
summary.zh: “overidealizes”表示“过度理想化”，把人或事看得比现实更完美。

definition.en: to see someone or something as far more perfect, good, or admirable than they really are; to idealize too much
definition.zh: 把某人或某事看得过于完美、过分美化；过度理想化

examples.en: She overidealizes her first job and forgets how stressful it actually was.
examples.zh: 她把第一份工作过度理想化了，忘了它其实有多压力。

examples.en: He overidealizes the past, so today always feels disappointing to him.
examples.zh: 他过度美化过去，所以今天在他看来总是不够好。

examples.en: The movie overidealizes friendship, making every conflict seem easy to solve.
examples.zh: 这部电影把友情过度理想化，让每个冲突看起来都很容易解决。

extraExplanation: “overidealizes”是动词“overidealize”的第三人称单数（he/she/it overidealizes）。常用于谈恋爱、家庭、名人崇拜、政治观点或“怀旧”时，表示因为期待过高而更容易失望。
构词上是 over-（过度）+ idealize（理想化）。语气通常带有批评或提醒：并不是否定优点，而是强调“不够现实”。

summary.en: “Overidealizing” means imagining someone or something as unrealistically perfect, often ignoring flaws.
summary.zh: “Overidealizing”指把某人或某事过度理想化，想得不切实际地完美，常常忽视缺点。

definition.en: present participle of overidealize; thinking about someone or something in an unrealistically perfect way, ignoring flaws or limits
definition.zh: overidealize 的现在分词；把某人或某事想得过于完美、不切实际，忽视缺点或限制

examples.en: She caught herself overidealizing the new job before reading the contract carefully.
examples.zh: 她发现自己在仔细看合同之前，就把这份新工作想得过于完美。

examples.en: We’re overidealizing our relationship if we pretend we never argue.
examples.zh: 如果我们假装从不争吵，那就是把这段关系过度理想化了。

examples.en: Overidealizing a leader can make it hard to see real problems.
examples.zh: 过度理想化一位领导者会让人难以看清真实问题。

definition.en: showing or involving an unrealistic, overly perfect view
definition.zh: （用作形容词）带有不切实际的“过分完美化”视角的

examples.en: His overidealizing comments made the plan sound easier than it was.
examples.zh: 他那些过度理想化的评论让这个计划听起来比实际更容易。

examples.en: An overidealizing view of success can lead to disappointment.
examples.zh: 对成功的过度理想化看法可能导致失望。

extraExplanation: “overidealize/overidealizing”常见于谈论亲密关系、偶像崇拜、职业期待或自我形象：当你只看到优点、把期待拉得太高，就容易在现实出现摩擦时感到落差。
和“idealize（理想化）”相比，前面加 over- 强调“过度、超出合理程度”。学习时可以把它理解为“把滤镜开太强”。

summary.en: “Overidentified” means being too strongly attached to an identity, role, or label, as if it defines the whole self.
summary.zh: “Overidentified”指过度把自己与某个身份/角色/标签绑定，好像它定义了全部的自我。

definition.en: (often in psychology or identity talk) too strongly identified with a role, group, label, or opinion; treating it as the whole of who someone is.
definition.zh: （常见于心理学/身份认同语境）过度把自己与某个角色、群体、标签或观点绑定；把它当作“全部的自我”。

examples.en: After the promotion, he became overidentified with his job and couldn’t relax at home.
examples.zh: 升职后，他过度把自己和工作绑定，回到家也放松不下来。

examples.en: If we get overidentified with one political view, it’s harder to listen openly to others.
examples.zh: 如果我们过度认同某一种政治观点，就更难以开放的态度倾听他人。

examples.en: The therapist said she was overidentified with being the “responsible one” in the family.
examples.zh: 治疗师说她过度把自己当成家里“负责的人”这个角色。

extraExplanation: 这个词常用于自我觉察、心理治疗、职场/家庭角色讨论中，含义接近“把标签当成自我本体”。它通常带有提醒或批评意味：当人过度认同某个身份时，容易变得防御、焦虑，或难以接受不同意见。
常见搭配：overidentified with + 名词/动名词（overidentified with work / being right / a label）。
相关概念（不完全等同）："enmeshment"（过度纠缠/界限不清）、"ego identification"（自我认同于某角色）。

summary.en: Overidentify means to identify or relate to someone/something too strongly, or (less commonly) to misidentify someone/something.
summary.zh: overidentify 指“过度认同/过度代入”，较少见时也可指“误认”。

definition.en: To identify with someone or something too strongly, or to interpret a situation as more personally relevant than it really is.
definition.zh: 过度认同；把某人/某事看得与自己过于相关；（对情境）过度代入、过度解读为与自己有关。

examples.en: Some fans overidentify with celebrities and feel personally attacked by criticism of them.
examples.zh: 有些粉丝会对明星过度认同，别人一批评就觉得是在攻击自己。

examples.en: If you overidentify with your job, a small mistake can feel like a failure as a person.
examples.zh: 如果你对工作过度认同，一点小失误都可能让你觉得自己这个人很失败。

examples.en: Try not to overidentify with one comment online; it may not be about you.
examples.zh: 别对网上一句话过度代入；它可能根本不是在说你。

definition.en: To mistakenly recognize someone or something as being the same as someone or something else (less common).
definition.zh: （较少见）误认；把人或事物认错成另一个。

examples.en: Witnesses sometimes overidentify suspects when they are under stress.
examples.zh: 目击者在压力下有时会把嫌疑人误认成别人。

extraExplanation: “overidentify”由 over-（过度）+ identify（认同/辨认）构成，常见于心理学、社交媒体讨论或自我成长语境，强调“界限感不足”：把外界评价、某个角色（如工作、身份、粉丝身份）与自我价值绑得太紧。
近义表达可根据语境选择：overinvest (emotionally)（情感投入过多）、take something personally（太往心里去）、project（投射）、misidentify（误认）。

summary.en: Overidentifying means identifying too strongly with someone or something, often losing objectivity or boundaries.
summary.zh: overidentifying 指对某人或某事过度认同/过度代入，常导致失去客观性或界限感。

definition.en: identifying with someone or something too strongly, often to the point of losing objectivity or healthy boundaries.
definition.zh: 对某人或某事过度认同（或过度代入），强到可能失去客观判断或健康界限。

examples.en: As a therapist, she avoided overidentifying with clients so she could stay objective.
examples.zh: 作为治疗师，她避免对来访者过度认同，这样才能保持客观。

examples.en: He was overidentifying with the main character and took every criticism of the book personally.
examples.zh: 他对主角过度代入，把别人对这本书的批评都当成在针对自己。

definition.en: the act of identifying with someone or something too strongly; becoming too emotionally involved.
definition.zh: 过度认同（的行为）；在情感上过度卷入。

examples.en: Overidentifying can make it hard to see other people’s perspectives.
examples.zh: 过度认同会让人很难看到别人的立场。

examples.en: Her overidentifying with her team’s success made every loss feel devastating.
examples.zh: 她对团队胜利的过度认同让每一次失败都显得毁灭性。

definition.en: present participle of “overidentify”: to identify with someone or something too strongly.
definition.zh: “overidentify”的现在分词：对某人或某事认同得过于强烈。

examples.en: He is overidentifying with the role and forgetting it’s just a job.
examples.zh: 他正在对这个角色过度认同，忘了这只是一份工作。

extraExplanation: 在心理学或助人行业语境里，overidentifying 常与“界限（boundaries）”相关：当你把对方的问题当成自己的问题，可能会影响判断、带来情绪耗竭。它也常用于粉丝文化、身份政治或团队文化中，表示把自我价值过度绑定在某个身份/群体/作品上。

summary.en: Overidle means “too idle or not busy enough,” often implying boredom or trouble.
summary.zh: overidle 指“过于闲散、太不忙”，常暗示无聊或容易惹事。

definition.en: (Of a person, mind, or time) too idle; not busy enough, often leading to boredom or mischief.
definition.zh: （人、头脑或时间）过于闲散的；太不忙的，常因此感到无聊或惹事。

examples.en: During the long holiday, he became overidle and started picking fights online.
examples.zh: 长假期间他太闲了（过于闲散），就开始在网上找人吵架。

examples.en: An overidle mind can turn small worries into big problems.
examples.zh: 过于闲散的头脑容易把小担忧放大成大问题。

definition.en: to make (someone) too idle; to leave with too little to do (rare).
definition.zh: 使（某人）过于闲散；让（某人）无事可做（较少见）。

examples.en: The easy schedule overidled the trainees, so the coach added more practice.
examples.zh: 训练安排太轻松，让学员们过于闲散，于是教练增加了练习。

synonyms: having too much time on one’s hands
extraExplanation: 这个词由 over-（“过度”）+ idle（“闲着的”）构成，属于较少见的书面或文学用词；日常英语更常用 too idle / overly idle / have too much time on one’s hands。
在较老的英语文本里，它有时带一点道德评判色彩：认为“太闲”会导致懒散、流言或惹事。

summary.en: Overidleness means excessive idleness—being inactive or unoccupied for too long.
summary.zh: overidleness 指“过度懒散/过度无所事事”，强调闲得太久、活动和目标感不足。

definition.en: a state of being idle too much; excessive lack of work, activity, or purposeful effort
definition.zh: 过度懒散；过度无所事事（闲得太久、缺乏工作或有意义的活动）

examples.en: Overidleness can make the day feel longer and the mind feel dull.
examples.zh: 过度无所事事会让一天显得更漫长，也会让头脑变得迟钝。

examples.en: The teacher warned that overidleness during vacation could make it harder to return to study routines.
examples.zh: 老师提醒说，假期里过度懒散可能会让开学后更难恢复学习节奏。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，更常用的表达是“too much idleness / excessive idleness / prolonged idleness”。它由 over-（过度）+ idleness（懒散、闲置）构成，多用于强调“闲得过头”带来的负面影响（如失去动力、效率下降）。

summary.en: “Overidly” is not standard; it’s usually a misspelling of “overly” (too; excessively) or sometimes confusion with “idly” (without purpose; lazily).
summary.zh: “overidly” 不是标准用法；通常是把 “overly”（过于）拼错了，或与 “idly”（懒散地/无所事事地）混淆。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; usually a misspelling. Most commonly, people mean “overly” (too; excessively).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；通常是拼写错误。最常见是想写 “overly”（过于；太；过度地）。

examples.en: He was overidly critical. (Better: He was overly critical.)
examples.zh: 他 overidly 挑剔。（更好：He was overly critical. 他过于挑剔。）

examples.en: Don’t worry overidly about small mistakes. (Better: Don’t worry overly about small mistakes.)
examples.zh: 别 overidly 担心小错误。（更好：Don’t worry overly about small mistakes. 别过度担心小错误。）

definition.en: If you meant “idly”: without purpose; lazily; not actively doing something.
definition.zh: 如果你想写的是 “idly”：漫无目的地；懒散地；无所事事地。

examples.en: He sat idly by the window.
examples.zh: 他懒散地坐在窗边。

examples.en: The workers were not standing idly; they were planning the next step.
examples.zh: 工人们并不是无所事事；他们在计划下一步。

extraExplanation:
“overidly” 这种拼法在词典和常见语料里基本找不到，写作中通常会被当作拼写错误。最可能的目标词是：
- overly = “太/过于”（程度副词，常见搭配 overly expensive/overly sensitive/overly optimistic）
- idly = “懒散地/无所事事地”（方式副词，常见搭配 sit idly/stand idly by）
如果你把原句发我，我可以帮你判断到底该用哪个。

summary.en: “Overidness” is not standard English; it’s usually a mistaken or informal form meaning “the state of being overridden.”
summary.zh: “overidness”不是标准英语；多半是拼写错误或随口造词，想表达“被覆盖/被否决的状态”。

definition.en: Nonstandard/spelling variant. Usually intended to mean “the state of being overridden” (something has been replaced, canceled, or given lower priority), especially in computing or rules/policies.
definition.zh: 非标准/拼写变体。通常想表达“被覆盖/被否决的状态”（某事被替代、取消，或优先级被压过），常见于计算机或规则/政策语境。

examples.en: In the settings, the admin override caused the previous value to be ignored (sometimes informally called “overidness”).
examples.zh: 在设置里，管理员的强制覆盖让之前的数值被忽略了（有时有人随口写成 overidness）。

examples.en: If you mean the condition of being overridden, clearer words are “override” or “being overridden,” not “overidness.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“被覆盖的状态”，更清楚的说法是“override（覆盖/强制更改）”或“being overridden（被覆盖）”，而不是 overidness。

extraExplanation: “overidness”一般不是标准英语单词，常见原因是把 override / overridden / overriding 之类的词拼错或临时造词。正式写作里建议用：override（名词/动词）、overriding (adj.)、be overridden（被覆盖/被否决）。如果你告诉我你的句子原文或语境（比如编程、权限、政策），我可以帮你改成最自然的英文。

summary.en: “Overidolatrous” means excessively or unhealthily worshipful/admiring—like treating someone or something as an idol.
summary.zh: “overidolatrous”指过度、失去理性的崇拜或仰慕，像把某人或某物当成偶像。

definition.en: Excessively devoted to someone or something in a way that feels like worship; too admiring or reverent.
definition.zh: 对某人或某物过度崇拜（近乎当作神来敬拜）；过分仰慕、过度敬奉。

examples.en: Some fans can become overidolatrous, treating a celebrity’s every word as truth.
examples.zh: 有些粉丝会变得过度崇拜，把名人的每一句话都当成真理。

examples.en: Her biography warns against an overidolatrous view of the leader and includes his mistakes, too.
examples.zh: 她的传记提醒人们不要对这位领袖抱有过度崇拜的看法，也写进了他的错误。

examples.en: The essay criticizes an overidolatrous attitude toward technology, as if it can solve every human problem.
examples.zh: 这篇文章批评了对科技的过度崇拜，仿佛它能解决所有人类问题。

extraExplanation: “overidolatrous”较少见，属于由前缀“over-（过度）”+ “idolatrous（偶像崇拜的；盲目崇拜的）”构成的加强语。写作中常用来带有批评意味，强调“崇拜到了不理性/不健康的程度”。
与“admiring（欣赏）”“respectful（尊敬）”不同，“idolatrous/overidolatrous”通常暗示失去客观判断，甚至把人或事物当成绝对权威。

summary.en: “Overidolatrously” means doing or speaking with too much idolization or devotion.
summary.zh: “Overidolatrously”表示“以过度崇拜、过分仰慕的方式”。

definition.en: In an excessively idolizing or worshipful way; with too much admiration or devotion (often implying it is unhealthy or unreasonable).
definition.zh: 以过度崇拜、过分敬奉的方式；带着不健康或不理性的过度仰慕（常含贬义）。

examples.en: Some fans speak overidolatrously about the singer, as if she can do no wrong.
examples.zh: 有些粉丝用过度崇拜的口吻谈论那位歌手，好像她永远不会犯错。

examples.en: He treated his mentor overidolatrously, ignoring the mentor’s real flaws.
examples.zh: 他对导师过度崇拜，忽视了导师真实的缺点。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、偏书面或批评语气的副词，来自 over-（过度）+ idolatrous（偶像崇拜的、盲目崇拜的）+ -ly（副词后缀）。
常用于评论“粉丝文化”“名人崇拜”“权威崇拜”等情境，语气往往带有提醒或批判：不是普通的 admire（欣赏），而是接近 worship（崇拜）。
更常见的表达包括：excessively / blindly / worshipfully / with undue admiration 等；在日常口语中很少直接用 overidolatrously。

summary.en: Overidolatrousness means excessive, often unhealthy idol-worship or admiration.
summary.zh: overidolatrousness 指“过度（且常带不健康倾向的）偶像崇拜/迷恋”。

definition.en: The quality of being excessively idolatrous; showing extreme or unhealthy worship/admiration toward a person, object, or idea.
definition.zh: 过度偶像崇拜（的状态/性质）；对某个人、事物或观念表现出极端或不健康的崇拜与迷恋。

examples.en: Some critics argued that the celebrity culture encouraged overidolatrousness rather than healthy appreciation of talent.
examples.zh: 一些评论家认为，名人文化助长的是过度偶像崇拜，而不是对才华的健康欣赏。

examples.en: His overidolatrousness of the company’s founder made him ignore serious problems in management.
examples.zh: 他对公司创始人的过度崇拜，让他忽视了管理上的严重问题。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、偏“造词/学术化”的名词，由 over-（过度）+ idolatrous（偶像崇拜的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“性质/状态”）组成。日常写作更常用 excessive adoration / hero-worship / idolatry 来表达类似意思。
语感上它带有批评色彩：强调“崇拜到不理性”的程度，而不仅仅是“很喜欢”。在讨论粉丝文化、政治人物个人崇拜、品牌迷信等话题时更贴切。

summary.en: Overijssel is a province in the eastern Netherlands.
summary.zh: Overijssel 指荷兰东部的上艾瑟尔省。

definition.en: A province in the eastern Netherlands, known for cities such as Zwolle, Deventer, and Enschede.
definition.zh: 荷兰东部的一个省（上艾瑟尔省），以兹沃勒、代芬特尔、恩斯赫德等城市闻名。

examples.en: Zwolle is the capital city of Overijssel.
examples.zh: 兹沃勒是上艾瑟尔省的省会。

examples.en: She traveled through Overijssel to visit Deventer and its historic center.
examples.zh: 她穿行上艾瑟尔省，去参观代芬特尔及其历史城区。

extraExplanation: “Overijssel”是荷兰语地名，字面可理解为“在艾瑟尔河（IJssel）之上/对岸的地区”，与当地河流与地理位置有关。
英文里它通常作为专有名词使用（省名），写作 Overijssel；中文常译作“上艾瑟尔省”。
发音上，重音通常落在后半部分（-ijssel）；其中 “ij” 在荷兰语里类似英语的 /eɪ/ 音（近似）。

summary.en: “Overillustrate” means to explain or illustrate something too much, using excessive examples or visuals.
summary.zh: “overillustrate”指用过多的例子或图示来说明某事，导致显得过度、累赘。

definition.en: to illustrate or explain with too many pictures, examples, or details, so that it feels excessive or distracting
definition.zh: 用过多的图示、例子或细节来说明（以至于显得多余或分散注意力）

examples.en: The slides overillustrate the point with five nearly identical charts.
examples.zh: 这些幻灯片用五张几乎一样的图表把重点“过度图示”了。

examples.en: Try not to overillustrate your essay—one strong example is usually enough.
examples.zh: 写作文尽量别过度举例或配图——一个有力的例子通常就够了。

examples.en: The manual overillustrates each step, which makes it harder to find what you need.
examples.zh: 说明书把每一步都配了太多图，反而更难快速找到需要的信息。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、太……”，放在动词前常带有“做得过头了”的含义：例如 overthink（想太多）、overexplain（解释过度）。因此 overillustrate 往往暗含“本来想帮助理解，但信息量过多导致效果变差”。
这个词不算特别高频，更常见的表达有 overexplain（解释过度）、give too many examples（举太多例子）、use too many illustrations（用太多插图）。在写作、演讲、做PPT、写说明书等语境里会更常用。

summary.en: Overillustrated means having too many illustrations, or (figuratively) being explained with too many examples/details.
summary.zh: overillustrated 指插图过多；也可比喻指举例/细节过多、讲解过度。

definition.en: Having too many illustrations or decorative pictures, so the page/design looks crowded.
definition.zh: 插图（或装饰图）过多的；过度配图的（导致版面显得拥挤）。

examples.en: The children’s book felt overillustrated, with a picture on nearly every line.
examples.zh: 这本儿童书显得插图太多，几乎每一行旁边都有一张图。

examples.en: The brochure is overillustrated, so the key information is hard to find.
examples.zh: 这份宣传册配图过多，所以关键信息反而不好找。

definition.en: Figuratively: explained with too many examples or details, making it longer than necessary.
definition.zh: （比喻）举例或细节过多的；讲解过度的（显得冗长）。

examples.en: Her essay is clear, but it’s a bit overillustrated with repeated examples.
examples.zh: 她的文章很清楚，但重复举例有点过度，显得冗长。

examples.en: Try not to overillustrate your point—one strong example is enough.
examples.zh: 别把观点解释得太“配图式”冗长——一个有力的例子就够了。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、太多”；“illustrated”既可以指“有插图的”，也可以指“用例子说明的”。因此 overillustrated 既可用于出版/版式（图太多），也可用于写作/表达（例子太多）。
常见近义表达：too many pictures / overly illustrated（图太多）；overexplained / too detailed（解释太多）。

summary.en: Overillustrating means explaining or presenting something with too many examples or visuals, making it less clear.
summary.zh: overillustrating 指用过多例子或图示来说明内容，反而降低清晰度。

definition.en: explaining something with too many examples, details, or visuals, so it becomes repetitive or less clear.
definition.zh: 用过多的例子、细节或图示来解释，导致内容重复或反而不清楚。

examples.en: The teacher was overillustrating the point, and students got lost in the extra details.
examples.zh: 老师为了说明观点举了太多例子，学生反而被额外细节带偏了。

examples.en: Try not to keep overillustrating—one strong example is usually enough.
examples.zh: 尽量别一直过度举例——一个有力的例子通常就够了。

definition.en: adding too many pictures or diagrams to a book, article, or presentation.
definition.zh: 在书籍、文章或演示中加入过多图片或图表。

examples.en: The editor warned that we were overillustrating the chapter and distracting readers from the text.
examples.zh: 编辑提醒我们这一章插图太多，会分散读者对正文的注意力。

examples.en: The slides felt crowded because we kept overillustrating every step.
examples.zh: 幻灯片显得很拥挤，因为我们每一步都加了太多图示。

extraExplanation: “over-”这个前缀常表示“过度、太多”（如 overwork 过度工作，overthink 想太多）。因此 overillustrate/overillustrating 通常带有“做过头了”的负面语气。
在写作或演讲中，适度的例子能帮助理解；但“overillustrating”会让重点被淹没，读者/听众更难抓住主线。

summary.en: Overillustration means using too many illustrations or visuals, making content cluttered or distracting.
summary.zh: Overillustration 指插图或视觉元素使用过多，导致内容显得杂乱或分散注意力。

definition.en: The act of adding too many pictures, diagrams, or visual details, so the main message becomes cluttered or confusing.
definition.zh: （对文字或内容）过度配图、过度插图；因图像或视觉细节太多而显得杂乱、难以抓住重点。

examples.en: The manual suffered from overillustration, and it was hard to find the steps you actually needed.
examples.zh: 这本说明书因为过度配图而显得很乱，很难找到真正需要的操作步骤。

examples.en: To avoid overillustration, use one clear diagram instead of five similar images.
examples.zh: 为了避免过度配图，与其放五张相似图片，不如用一张清晰的示意图。

definition.en: A specific set of excessive illustrations or visual decorations in a book, article, slide deck, or design.
definition.zh: （书籍、文章、幻灯片或设计中）一组过多的插图/装饰性图像；过量的视觉元素配置。

examples.en: The editor asked us to cut the overillustration in the first chapter.
examples.zh: 编辑让我们删减第一章里那些过量的插图。

examples.en: The presentation’s overillustration distracted the audience from the data.
examples.zh: 这份演示的过度配图让观众注意力偏离了数据本身。

extraExplanation: “over-”这个前缀常表示“过度、太多”（如 overwork 过度工作，overthink 想太多）。因此 overillustration 直观上就是“插图过多”。
这个词在日常口语里不算常见，更常见的表达是“too many illustrations/images”或“overly illustrated”。在写作、排版、教学课件等语境中更容易见到。

summary.en: Overillustrative describes writing or speaking that uses too many examples or details, making the message longer or less clear.
summary.zh: overillustrative 指写作或表达中举例/细节过多，导致内容冗长或不够清晰。

definition.en: Using too many examples, details, or explanations, so that something becomes longer or less clear than necessary.
definition.zh: 过度举例或过度说明的；用太多细节/例子导致表达冗长或不够清晰的。

examples.en: The report is accurate, but it’s overillustrative and hard to skim.
examples.zh: 这份报告很准确，但举例太多、太啰嗦，不容易快速浏览。

examples.en: Try not to be overillustrative—one strong example is usually enough.
examples.zh: 尽量别过度举例——通常一个有力的例子就够了。

examples.en: His explanation became overillustrative and the main point got lost.
examples.zh: 他的解释变得过度说明，结果重点反而被淹没了。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度/太……”（如 overconfident 过度自信、overthink 想太多），“illustrative”表示“用来说明的/举例说明的”。合在一起就是“举例说明得过头”。
这是偏正式、常见于写作批评或编辑建议的词：并不是说例子不好，而是提醒“例子过多会影响重点、节奏与可读性”。写作中常用的替代说法有：too detailed（太细）、overly explained（解释过度）、wordy（冗长）。

summary.en: “Overillustratively” means doing something with too many examples or explanatory details, often to the point of being excessive.
summary.zh: “Overillustratively”指以过多例子或说明细节来表达，常常多到显得冗余或过头。

definition.en: In a way that explains or shows something with too many illustrations, examples, or details (so it may feel excessive or unnecessary).
definition.zh: 以一种“过度举例/过度说明”的方式（用太多插图、例子或细节来解释，显得冗余或过分）。

examples.en: The report was written overillustratively, with long side stories that distracted from the main point.
examples.zh: 这份报告写得过度说明，夹杂了很多旁支故事，反而分散了重点。

examples.en: He taught the grammar point overillustratively, giving ten examples when three would have been enough.
examples.zh: 他讲这个语法点讲得过度举例，给了十个例子，其实三个就够了。

definition.en: (Literary/rare) In an overly decorative or picture-like way, especially in writing or design.
definition.zh: （文学/少见）以过于装饰、过于“图像化”的方式（尤指写作或设计风格）。

examples.en: The description is overillustratively vivid, leaving little room for the reader’s imagination.
examples.zh: 这段描写生动得有些过头，几乎不给读者想象空间。

extraExplanation: “overillustratively”由 over-（过度）+ illustrative（说明性的/示意性的）+ -ly（副词后缀）构成，意思通常带有轻微批评：信息多到影响清晰度或重点。
这个词在日常英语里比较少见；更常见的表达有：“with too many examples / in an overly detailed way / over-explain(ing)”。写作中使用它会显得较正式或偏学术评论语气。

summary.en: Overimaginative means having too much imagination in a way that becomes unrealistic or exaggerated.
summary.zh: overimaginative 指想象过度，以至于显得不切实际或夸张。

definition.en: Having too much imagination; creating ideas that are unrealistic, exaggerated, or unlikely to be true.
definition.zh: 想象过度的；过于天马行空的（常指不切实际、夸张或不太可能为真）。

examples.en: His overimaginative story sounded exciting, but it probably didn’t happen that way.
examples.zh: 他那段过于天马行空的故事听起来很刺激，但大概不是那样发生的。

examples.en: The report was criticized for being overimaginative and not based on solid evidence.
examples.zh: 这份报告因过于想象化、缺乏扎实证据而受到批评。

examples.en: Try not to be overimaginative when you read the email—ask for clarification instead.
examples.zh: 读那封邮件时别过度脑补，最好直接去问清楚。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、太……”，所以 overimaginative 往往带有轻微的负面评价：不是单纯“有创意”，而是“想太多/不够现实”。如果想表达正面“富有想象力”，更常用 imaginative 或 creative。

summary.en: “Overimaginatively” means doing or thinking in an overly imaginative, unrealistic way.
summary.zh: “overimaginatively”指以过度想象、偏离现实的方式去描述、思考或解读。

definition.en: In a way that is too imaginative; by imagining things more than is reasonable or realistic.
definition.zh: 过度地（或不切实际地）富于想象；想得太多、太夸张。

examples.en: She described the event overimaginatively, adding details that never happened.
examples.zh: 她把那件事讲得过于天马行空，还加了很多并未发生的细节。

examples.en: Don’t read his message overimaginatively—it’s probably just a simple update.
examples.zh: 别把他的消息过度脑补——很可能只是个简单的更新。

examples.en: The story is written overimaginatively, which can confuse younger readers.
examples.zh: 这篇故事写得过度夸张，可能会让年幼的读者感到困惑。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度/太……”，加在“imaginative（富有想象力的）”前形成“overimaginative（过度想象的）”，再加“-ly”变成副词“overimaginatively”。
这个词在日常英语中不算常见；更自然的表达常用“too imaginatively / in an overly imaginative way / overactively imagining”等来替代，语气更口语、也更易懂。

summary.en: Overimaginativeness means an overly active imagination that can lead to unrealistic or exaggerated ideas.
summary.zh: overimaginativeness 指“过度想象”，即想象力过于活跃，容易产生不切实际或夸张的想法。

definition.en: The quality or habit of imagining too much, especially in a way that is unrealistic, exaggerated, or not based on evidence.
definition.zh: 过度想象（的习惯或特质）；尤指不切实际、夸张或缺乏根据的想象。

examples.en: Her overimaginativeness sometimes turns small problems into disasters in her mind.
examples.zh: 她的过度想象有时会把小问题在脑海里放大成灾难。

examples.en: The rumor spread because of people’s overimaginativeness, not because of facts.
examples.zh: 谣言之所以传播，是因为人们过度想象，而不是因为事实。

examples.en: A little creativity helps, but overimaginativeness can make planning unrealistic.
examples.zh: 一点创造力有帮助，但过度想象会让计划变得不现实。

extraExplanation: “overimaginativeness”不是非常常见的标准词，更多时候人们会说：overactive imagination（想象力过于活跃）、excessive imagination（过度的想象）、fantasy-prone（容易沉浸幻想的）。
构词：over-（过度）+ imaginative（富于想象的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“性质/状态”）。因此它强调的是一种“倾向/特质”。
语气上通常带轻微负面含义：暗示把事情想得太复杂、太戏剧化或脱离现实；在写作中可用于批评，也可用于自嘲。

summary.en: “Overimbibe” means to drink too much, usually alcohol.
summary.zh: “overimbibe”指饮用过量，通常指喝酒过量。

definition.en: to drink too much, especially alcohol; to overindulge in drinking
definition.zh: 饮用过量（尤指酒精）；过度饮酒

examples.en: He overimbibed at the party and had to take a taxi home.
examples.zh: 他在派对上喝过量了，只好打车回家。

examples.en: Try not to overimbibe if you have an early meeting tomorrow.
examples.zh: 如果你明天一早要开会，尽量别喝过量。

extraExplanation: “overimbibe”由前缀 over-（过度）+ imbibe（饮用；吸收）组成，语气较正式、带一点文学/书面色彩。日常更常说 “drink too much / overdrink / drink excessively”。

summary.en: Overimbibed means having drunk too much (usually alcohol), and sometimes figuratively having absorbed too much of something.
summary.zh: overimbibed 指（通常是酒）喝得过多而醉；也可比喻对某事物吸收过量。

definition.en: Having drunk too much alcohol; overly intoxicated.
definition.zh: （酒）喝得过多的；过度饮酒而醉的。

examples.en: He was clearly overimbibed and started speaking louder than usual.
examples.zh: 他显然喝多了，说话声比平时大得多。

examples.en: The staff refused to serve anyone who seemed overimbibed.
examples.zh: 工作人员拒绝为看起来喝醉的人继续提供酒精饮品。

definition.en: (Figurative) Having absorbed too much of something (ideas, culture, information), often to an excessive degree.
definition.zh: （比喻）吸收/接受某事物过多（如观念、文化、信息），到了过头的程度。

examples.en: After a week of nonstop news, she felt overimbibed and mentally exhausted.
examples.zh: 一周不停刷新闻后，她觉得信息摄入过量，精神很疲惫。

examples.en: He sounded a bit overimbibed in self-help slogans.
examples.zh: 他听起来有点把自助书口号“吸收过量”了。

extraExplanation: “overimbibed”常带一点幽默或较正式的语气，用来委婉地说“喝醉了/喝多了”，比直接说 drunk 更含蓄。
imbibe 本意是“饮用”，也可指“吸收（思想、文化）”；加上 over- 表示“过度”。因此它既能指酒喝多，也能比喻“摄入过量”。
在文学或较讲究的写作里，作者有时用这类词来制造轻微的讽刺或文雅的距离感（像在用“学术腔”描述醉态）。

summary.en: “Overimbibes” means “drinks too much,” usually alcohol (rare word; sometimes used figuratively for taking in too much information).
summary.zh: “Overimbibes”指“喝得太多（通常指酒）”，是较少见的用词；也可少见地比喻“吸收/接收过多信息”。

definition.en: (third-person singular of **overimbibe**) to drink too much alcohol; to overindulge in drinking.
definition.zh: （**overimbibe** 的第三人称单数）饮酒过量；酗酒、喝得太多。

examples.en: He sometimes overimbibes at office parties and regrets it the next day.
examples.zh: 他有时在公司聚会上喝得太多，第二天就后悔。

examples.en: If she overimbibes, she gets a headache quickly.
examples.zh: 如果她饮酒过量，很快就会头痛。

definition.en: (figurative, rare) to take in too much of something, such as information or opinions.
definition.zh: （比喻用法，较少见）吸收/接收过多（如信息、观点等）。

examples.en: After hours online, he overimbibes news and feels anxious.
examples.zh: 在网上刷了好几个小时后，他“摄入”了过量新闻，变得焦虑。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，更常见的表达是 **drink too much / overdrink / binge-drink**（狂饮）。
**over-** 表示“过度”，**imbibe** 原意是“喝（尤指酒）”，也可引申为“吸收（思想、信息）”。因此 **overimbibe** 字面就是“喝/吸收得过多”。
在正式写作里，**imbibe** 往往带一点文学或幽默色彩；用 **overimbibes** 会显得更刻意、更书面。

summary.en: Overimbibing means drinking excessively; less commonly, it can mean absorbing too much of something (figuratively).
summary.zh: overimbibing 指饮用过量（尤指饮酒）；较少见时也可比喻为过度吸收某种信息或观念。

definition.en: drinking too much alcohol (or too much of any drink); excessive drinking
definition.zh: 饮酒（或喝任何饮料）过量；过度饮用

examples.en: The doctor warned him that overimbibing could damage his liver.
examples.zh: 医生警告他，过度饮酒可能会损害肝脏。

examples.en: After a stressful week, she promised herself she wouldn’t go out overimbibing again.
examples.zh: 在压力很大的一周之后，她答应自己不再出去喝得过量了。

definition.en: (figurative, less common) taking in too much of something, such as ideas, media, or information
definition.zh: （比喻，较少见）过度“吸收”某事物，如观点、媒体内容或信息

examples.en: He spent the weekend overimbibing political news and felt anxious afterward.
examples.zh: 他周末过度刷政治新闻，之后感到焦虑。

extraExplanation: “overimbibing”来自动词“imbibe”（意为“饮用；吸收”）加前缀“over-”（表示“过度”）。在正式或书面语里更常见；日常口语通常会说“drinking too much / overdrinking”。

summary.en: Overimitate means to imitate too much, in a way that feels excessive or unnatural.
summary.zh: overimitate 指“过度模仿”，模仿得太多而显得不自然或缺乏原创性。

definition.en: to imitate someone or something too much, so that it becomes unnatural, excessive, or loses originality
definition.zh: 过度模仿（某人/某事），以至于显得不自然、过头或缺乏原创性

examples.en: New actors sometimes overimitate famous stars and end up sounding unnatural.
examples.zh: 新演员有时会过度模仿明星，结果说话听起来很不自然。

examples.en: Don’t overimitate the model answer—use your own words.
examples.zh: 别过度照搬范文——用你自己的表达。

examples.en: If you overimitate your teacher’s style, your writing may lose its personal voice.
examples.zh: 如果你过度模仿老师的风格，你的写作可能会失去个人特色。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、太多”。所以 overimitate 强调“模仿得过头”，常带负面含义（不自然、缺乏原创）。
这个词在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达有：copy too much（抄/学太多）、imitate too closely（模仿得太像）、be a copycat（像跟风者/模仿者）。

summary.en: Overimitated means copied so much that it feels unoriginal or clichéd.
summary.zh: overimitated 指“被过度模仿，以至于显得不新颖或俗套”。

definition.en: Copied too much or too often, so it feels unoriginal, clichéd, or lacking freshness.
definition.zh: 被过度模仿的；模仿得太多（以至于显得缺乏新意、流于俗套）的。

examples.en: The melody is catchy, but the style feels overimitated in pop music today.
examples.zh: 旋律很抓耳，但这种风格在当今流行音乐里被模仿得太多，显得有点俗套。

examples.en: After years of trends, the once-bold look became overimitated and lost its impact.
examples.zh: 经过多年的潮流跟风，这种曾经大胆的造型被过度模仿，冲击力也就变弱了。

definition.en: (Of a person or creator) having had one’s work copied excessively by others.
definition.zh: （指人或创作者）作品被他人过度仿效的。

examples.en: Some designers feel overimitated when fast-fashion brands copy their signature pieces.
examples.zh: 当快时尚品牌抄袭他们的标志性作品时，一些设计师会觉得自己的作品被过度仿效了。

examples.en: The photographer complained that her concept was overimitated online without credit.
examples.zh: 这位摄影师抱怨自己的创意在网上被大量模仿，却没人署名。

extraExplanation: “over-”是英语里常见的前缀，表示“过度、太多”。所以 overimitated 字面意思就是“被模仿得过头”。常用来评价风格、点子、套路、梗等因为太多人照搬而变得不新鲜。
更常见、更自然的替代表达有：overcopied（被抄太多）、overused（被用烂了）、clichéd / cliché（俗套的）、derivative（缺乏原创、模仿痕迹重）。

summary.en: Overimitating means copying someone too much so it feels unnatural or exaggerated.
summary.zh: overimitating 指过度模仿，模仿得太多以至于显得不自然或夸张。

definition.en: (present participle) copying someone’s style, words, or actions too much, often so it looks unnatural, forced, or like a parody.
definition.zh: （现在分词）过度模仿某人的风格、措辞或行为，程度太高以至于显得不自然、做作，甚至像在讽刺/滑稽模仿。

examples.en: He was overimitating his teacher’s accent, and it came across as rude.
examples.zh: 他过度模仿老师的口音，让人感觉很不礼貌。

examples.en: She realized she was overimitating influencers online instead of developing her own style.
examples.zh: 她意识到自己在过度模仿网络红人，而不是发展自己的风格。

examples.en: The actor stopped overimitating and started focusing on the character’s emotions.
examples.zh: 那位演员不再过度模仿，开始把重点放在角色的情绪上。

extraExplanation: “overimitating”来自“over-（过度）+ imitate（模仿）”。它不是最常见的日常词，更常见的表达有：copying someone too much（模仿太多）、trying too hard to imitate（太用力在模仿）、doing a poor impression（拙劣的模仿）。
语气上常带轻微批评：强调“像得太刻意/太过头”，而不只是“模仿”。在学习口音、写作风格或职场表达时，会用来提醒：要吸收优点，但不要失去自己的自然表达。

summary.en: Overimitation means copying too closely or copying unnecessary steps, especially in learning contexts.
summary.zh: overimitation 指“过度模仿”，既可泛指模仿过头，也可特指学习中复制不必要步骤的现象。

definition.en: The act or habit of copying someone else too closely or too much, often without thinking for yourself.
definition.zh: 过度模仿；模仿过头（指不加思考地过分照搬他人的做法或风格）。

examples.en: His overimitation of his boss’s speaking style sounded unnatural.
examples.zh: 他过度模仿老板的说话方式，听起来很不自然。

examples.en: Overimitation can stop students from developing their own voice in writing.
examples.zh: 过度模仿可能会阻碍学生在写作中形成自己的风格。

definition.en: (In child development and learning) copying actions that are unnecessary for achieving a goal, especially when learning from an adult.
definition.zh: （儿童发展与学习领域）过度模仿：为了达成目标而复制一些其实不必要的动作，尤其常见于向成人学习时。

examples.en: In the experiment, children showed overimitation by repeating extra steps that did not help open the box.
examples.zh: 在实验中，孩子们表现出过度模仿：重复了一些对打开盒子并无帮助的额外步骤。

examples.en: Researchers study overimitation to understand how culture and teaching shape learning.
examples.zh: 研究者研究过度模仿，以理解文化与教学如何影响学习。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度/太……”，加在“imitation（模仿）”前面就变成“overimitation（过度模仿）”。
这个词在日常语境里可指“模仿过头、没有自己的想法”；在心理学与教育学语境里更常用来描述儿童学习时“把不必要的步骤也一并学走”的现象。
相关词：imitation（模仿）、copycat（盲目模仿者/跟风者）、mimicry（模仿行为，常偏生物学/社会行为用语）。

summary.en: Overimitative means “excessively copying others,” often implying a lack of originality.
summary.zh: overimitative 指“过度模仿他人”，常暗示缺乏原创性。

definition.en: Too eager to copy other people’s behavior, style, or ideas; excessively imitative in a way that can seem unoriginal.
definition.zh: 过度模仿的；一味照搬他人（行为、风格或想法）的，显得缺乏原创性。

examples.en: The critic said the band’s new album was overimitative and didn’t add anything new to the genre.
examples.zh: 评论家说这支乐队的新专辑过度模仿，没有给这种音乐类型带来新东西。

examples.en: At first her writing felt overimitative of her favorite author, but her own voice slowly emerged.
examples.zh: 起初她的写作很像是在过度模仿她最喜欢的作家，但后来她逐渐形成了自己的风格。

examples.en: Teachers may worry when a student becomes overimitative instead of experimenting with original ideas.
examples.zh: 当学生一味过度模仿而不去尝试原创想法时，老师可能会担心。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、太多”，而“-imitative”来自“imitate（模仿）”。因此 overimitative 强调“模仿过头”，带有批评意味，常用于艺术、写作、设计、行为等语境。
与 imitative（善于/倾向模仿的，中性或正面）相比，overimitative 更强调“缺乏创新、照搬痕迹明显”。

summary.en: “Overimitatively” means “in an overly imitative way,” copying too much and lacking originality.
summary.zh: “overimitatively”表示“过度模仿地”，强调模仿太多、缺乏原创性。

definition.en: In a way that imitates someone or something too much; excessively imitating rather than being original.
definition.zh: 以过度模仿的方式；模仿得太多而缺乏原创性。

examples.en: The actor played the role overimitatively, copying every gesture of the famous star instead of creating his own character.
examples.zh: 这位演员表演得过于模仿，把那位名星的每个动作都照搬了过来，而没有塑造出自己的角色。

examples.en: The student wrote overimitatively, sounding exactly like the textbook and not like a real person.
examples.zh: 这位学生写作太过模仿，读起来完全像课本，不像真实的人在表达。

extraExplanation: “overimitatively”由 over-（过度）+ imitative（模仿的）+ -ly（副词）构成，常见于批评写作、表演、艺术风格时，强调“模仿过头、失去个人风格”。
这个词非常少见；更常用、更自然的表达包括：“too imitatively / in an overly imitative way / with excessive imitation”。

summary.en: Overimitativeness means an excessive tendency to imitate others instead of developing your own way.
summary.zh: Overimitativeness 指过度模仿他人的倾向，强调缺乏自己的方式或风格。

definition.en: the tendency or quality of copying others too much or too closely; excessive imitation
definition.zh: 过度模仿的倾向或特质；模仿过头

examples.en: The artist fought against overimitativeness and tried to develop an original style.
examples.zh: 这位艺术家努力对抗过度模仿，试图发展出原创风格。

examples.en: Overimitativeness in writing can make your voice sound like someone else’s.
examples.zh: 写作中过度模仿会让你的文字声音听起来像别人的。

examples.en: Teachers sometimes encourage students to learn by imitation—but not to the point of overimitativeness.
examples.zh: 老师有时会鼓励学生通过模仿来学习——但不要模仿过头。

extraExplanation: “overimitativeness”不是很常见的日常词，更常见的表达是“overimitation”（过度模仿）或说某人“overly imitative / too imitative”。写作或批评场景里偶尔会用它来强调“像是在复制别人”，而不是在学习借鉴。
在心理学与发展研究里，“overimitation/过度模仿”常指儿童不仅模仿有效步骤，还会照做一些其实不必要的动作；这通常被解释为社会学习、对规范的敏感或对成人权威的信任。

summary.en: Overimmunize means to immunize excessively (more than needed), and it can also be used figuratively for overprotecting someone from risk.
summary.zh: overimmunize 指“过度免疫（超过需要的免疫/接种）”，也可比喻为“过度保护”，使人缺少应对风险的能力。

definition.en: to give more vaccination or immune stimulation than is necessary; to immunize excessively
definition.zh: 过度免疫；接种或刺激免疫反应超过必要程度

examples.en: Some parents worry that giving too many shots too close together might overimmunize a child, but they should ask a doctor for evidence-based guidance.
examples.zh: 一些家长担心在短时间内打太多疫苗会让孩子过度免疫，但应向医生咨询循证的建议。

examples.en: The clinic reviewed its schedule to avoid accidentally overimmunizing patients with duplicate doses.
examples.zh: 诊所检查了接种安排，以避免因重复剂量而让患者被过度免疫。

definition.en: (figurative) to protect someone so much that they become less prepared to handle real-life risk or difficulty
definition.zh: （比喻）过度保护，使人缺乏面对现实风险或困难的能力

examples.en: If we overimmunize students against failure, they may never learn resilience.
examples.zh: 如果我们让学生对失败“过度免疫”（过度防护），他们可能学不会韧性。

examples.en: The author warns against overimmunizing children from discomfort, because small challenges help them grow.
examples.zh: 作者警告不要让孩子远离不适到“过度免疫”的程度，因为小挑战有助于成长。

extraExplanation: “overimmunize”由前缀 over-（过度）+ immunize（使免疫）构成，属于较少见的用词；在医学写作中更常见的是“overvaccinate（过度接种）”或直接说“unnecessary/duplicate doses（不必要/重复剂量）”。
在公共健康语境里，这个词可能带有主观判断；讨论疫苗时，表达应尽量基于权威指南与具体情境（年龄、既往接种史、免疫缺陷等）。

summary.en: Overimmunized means having more immunizations than recommended/needed, or being excessively protected against a disease.
summary.zh: overimmunized 指接种的免疫针剂超过建议/需要，或引申为对疾病的免疫保护过强。

definition.en: Having received more vaccinations or booster shots than is medically recommended or needed (often used informally or critically).
definition.zh: （通常为非正式或带批评意味）接种了超过医学建议或实际需要的疫苗/加强针；“过度免疫”的。

examples.en: Some parents worry their child is overimmunized, but doctors usually follow a recommended schedule.
examples.zh: 有些家长担心孩子被“过度免疫”，但医生通常会遵循推荐的接种计划。

examples.en: The article argues that certain groups may be overimmunized due to repeated booster campaigns.
examples.zh: 这篇文章认为某些群体可能因为反复的加强针行动而出现“过度免疫”。

definition.en: In a broader sense, overly protected against a disease (for example, after vaccination plus strong natural immunity).
definition.zh: （引申义）对某种疾病过于“有保护力”的；免疫保护过强（例如疫苗接种后又叠加了很强的自然免疫）。

examples.en: After vaccination and a past infection, she felt almost overimmunized against the virus.
examples.zh: 在接种疫苗并感染过一次之后，她觉得自己对这种病毒几乎“免疫过头”了。

extraExplanation: “overimmunized”不是非常常见的标准医学术语，更常见的是说“over-vaccinated”（疫苗打得过多）或讨论“unnecessary boosters”（不必要的加强针）。
在医学沟通中是否“过度”取决于年龄、基础疾病、地区免疫规划、疫苗类型与间隔等；如果你在真实健康情境中看到这个词，通常带有观点或争议色彩。

summary.en: “Overimmunizing” means giving vaccines more often or in greater amounts than needed or recommended.
summary.zh: “overimmunizing”指疫苗接种过多、过频，超过需要或推荐。

definition.en: giving more immunizations (vaccines) than necessary, or vaccinating too often—beyond what is recommended.
definition.zh: （疫苗接种）过度免疫：接种次数或剂量超过需要，或超出推荐的接种频率。

examples.en: Some parents worry that overimmunizing might cause unnecessary side effects.
examples.zh: 有些家长担心过度免疫可能带来不必要的副作用。

examples.en: Doctors follow official schedules to avoid overimmunizing children.
examples.zh: 医生会遵循官方接种程序，以避免给儿童过度免疫。

examples.en: The clinic checked her records to make sure she wasn’t overimmunizing during the outbreak.
examples.zh: 诊所核对了她的接种记录，以确保在疫情期间没有出现过度免疫的情况。

extraExplanation: “overimmunizing”来自动词“overimmunize”（over- 表“过度” + immunize“使免疫/接种疫苗”）。在公共卫生语境中，这个词常用于讨论：是否重复接种、是否在不需要的情况下追加针次，或是否没有按指南间隔接种。
需要注意：在真实医疗场景里，是否“过度”通常以官方指南（例如国家/地区免疫规划、CDC/WHO建议）和个人健康状况为准；有时补种或追加剂量是医学上合理的，并不一定算“overimmunizing”。

summary.en: Overimport means to import too much, often in an economic or business context.
summary.zh: overimport 指“过度进口、进口过量”，常用于经济或商业语境。

definition.en: to import too much (more goods or materials than needed, affordable, or healthy for a market or economy).
definition.zh: 过度进口；进口过量（超过需求、承受能力或对市场/经济有利的程度）。

examples.en: If a country overimports food, local farmers may struggle to compete.
examples.zh: 如果一个国家过度进口食品，本国农民可能难以竞争。

examples.en: The company overimported parts and ended up with expensive inventory sitting in storage.
examples.zh: 这家公司零件进口过量，结果昂贵库存堆在仓库里。

definition.en: to bring in too much of something (less common, sometimes used outside trade contexts).
definition.zh: 过量引入（较少见，用法有时不局限于贸易语境）。

examples.en: The project overimported ideas from other teams instead of building its own approach.
examples.zh: 这个项目过度引入其他团队的想法，而不是建立自己的方法。

extraExplanation: “overimport”在现代英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是“import too much / excessive imports / overreliance on imports（过度依赖进口）”。
构词很直观：over-（过度）+ import（进口/输入）。常出现在经济、贸易分析或政策讨论中，用来强调“进口超过合理水平”带来的风险（如贸易逆差扩大、产业受冲击）。

summary.en: Overimportance means excessive importance given to someone or something.
summary.zh: overimportance 指对某人或某事赋予过度的重要性。

definition.en: the state of being considered too important; excessive importance given to someone or something
definition.zh: 被看得过于重要；对某人或某事赋予过度的重要性

examples.en: The report warns against the overimportance of test scores in judging students.
examples.zh: 报告警告不要在评估学生时过分看重考试分数。

examples.en: She disliked the overimportance placed on appearances at work.
examples.zh: 她不喜欢职场上对外表的过分强调。

extraExplanation: “overimportance”常用于较正式的写作或批评性语境，表示“把某件事看得太重”。更常见的表达包括：“too much importance (is placed on...) / excessive importance / overemphasis”。
常见搭配：the overimportance of X；place/attach/give overimportance to X。

summary.en: Overimportation means importing too much, often causing economic or trade problems.
summary.zh: overimportation 指“过度进口”，常用于经济与贸易语境，暗示可能带来负面影响。

definition.en: The act or situation of importing too much—especially more than a country or business needs or can afford.
definition.zh: 过度进口；（尤指）进口数量过多，超过一个国家或企业的需要或承受能力。

examples.en: Overimportation can weaken local industries if cheaper foreign goods flood the market.
examples.zh: 过度进口会削弱本地产业，因为更便宜的外国商品会大量涌入市场。

examples.en: The report warned that overimportation of fuel was increasing the trade deficit.
examples.zh: 报告警告说，燃料的过度进口正在扩大贸易逆差。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是“excessive imports / too much importing”。在经济新闻或政策讨论中，它通常与“trade deficit（贸易逆差）”“domestic producers（国内生产者）”“tariffs（关税）”“import dependence（进口依赖）”等话题一起出现。
构词法：over-（过度）+ importation（进口）。其中 importation 比 import 更偏“过程/行为”或更正式的书面语。

summary.en: Overimpose means to lay one thing over another, especially an image over an image, or to force an interpretation or rule onto something.
summary.zh: overimpose 指把一物叠加在另一物之上（尤指画面/图像叠加），也可指把某种解读或规则强加到某事物上。

definition.en: To place one image, pattern, or layer on top of another so they overlap.
definition.zh: 把一幅图像、图案或图层叠加在另一幅上，使其重叠。

examples.en: The editor overimposed the title over the opening scene.
examples.zh: 剪辑师把片名叠加在开场画面上。

examples.en: Try to overimpose the old map on the new one to see what has changed.
examples.zh: 试着把旧地图叠加到新地图上，看看有哪些变化。

definition.en: To add or apply something (such as an idea, rule, or interpretation) onto something else, sometimes in an unnatural or forced way.
definition.zh: 把某种东西（如观念、规则或解读）强加到另一事物之上（有时显得不自然或牵强）。

examples.en: Don’t overimpose modern values on people from the past.
examples.zh: 不要把现代价值观强加到过去的人身上。

examples.en: The teacher warned us not to overimpose our own assumptions on the text.
examples.zh: 老师提醒我们不要把自己的主观假设强加到文本上。

extraExplanation: 常见拼写：overimpose（也可见 over-impose）。重音通常在最后一部分：overimPOSE。
在摄影、影视和设计里，overimpose 常指“叠化/叠加字幕或画面”；在写作与人文讨论中，则常带有“把某种框架硬套上去”的语气。
相关词：superimpose（更中性、也更常用，强调“叠放/叠加”）；impose（强调“强加”）。

summary.en: “Overimposed” means laid or displayed on top of something else, especially images or text; it’s also the past form of “overimpose.”
summary.zh: “overimposed”指（图像/文字等）叠加在另一物或画面之上；也可作“overimpose”的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: Placed or shown on top of something else, especially one image, text, or pattern laid over another so both can be seen.
definition.zh: （尤指图像、文字等）叠加在另一物体或画面之上，使两者同时可见。

examples.en: The documentary used overimposed captions to translate the dialogue.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片用叠加字幕来翻译对话。

examples.en: A faint, overimposed map appeared over the city scene.
examples.zh: 城市画面上浮现出一张淡淡的叠加地图。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “overimpose”: to place or display something on top of something else (often in photography, film, or design).
definition.zh: “overimpose”的过去式/过去分词：把某物（常指照片、影片或设计中的图像/文字）叠加到另一物上或画面上。

examples.en: The editor overimposed the logo on the final shot.
examples.zh: 剪辑师把标志叠加到最后一个镜头上。

examples.en: Two exposures were overimposed to create a double-image effect.
examples.zh: 两次曝光被叠加在一起，产生了双重影像效果。

extraExplanation: “overimposed/overimpose”常见于摄影与电影术语：例如 double exposure（双重曝光）、superimposed text（叠加文字/字幕）。在日常表达里也可引申为“把某种观念/情绪强加或套在某事之上”，但这种用法不如视觉语境常见。

summary.en: Overimposing means layering one image/text over another; it can also mean applying something on top of something else in a broader sense.
summary.zh: overimposing 指把图像/文字叠加到另一层上；也可泛指把某事物叠加或强加在另一事物之上。

definition.en: Putting one image, piece of text, or object on top of another so they appear together (often in photography, video, design, or printing).
definition.zh: 把一张图像、文字或物体叠加到另一张上面，让它们同时出现（常见于摄影、视频、设计或印刷）。

examples.en: The editor is overimposing subtitles on the video.
examples.zh: 剪辑师正在把字幕叠加到视频上。

examples.en: Try overimposing a map over the satellite photo to compare locations.
examples.zh: 试着把地图叠加在卫星照片上来对比位置。

examples.en: The app lets you overimpose a logo on your pictures.
examples.zh: 这个应用可以让你把标志叠加到照片上。

definition.en: Placing or applying something on top of something else in a more general sense (less common).
definition.zh: 更一般地指把某物放在或施加在另一物之上（较不常用）。

examples.en: The new rules were overimposed on an already stressful schedule.
examples.zh: 新规定叠加在本已紧张的日程之上。

examples.en: He felt his family’s expectations were overimposed on his own goals.
examples.zh: 他觉得家人的期待被强加在自己的目标之上。

extraExplanation: “overimposing”是动词“overimpose”的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于描述正在进行的“叠加”操作。
在影视与平面设计里，overimpose常指把文字、字幕、特效或一段画面“叠印/叠加”到另一段画面上；中文常译为“叠加、叠印、覆盖（在……上）”。

summary.en: “Overimpress” means trying too hard to impress someone, often in an excessive or awkward way.
summary.zh: “overimpress”指为了给人留下印象而用力过猛，常显得过度或尴尬。

definition.en: to try too hard to impress someone, often in a way that feels unnatural or excessive
definition.zh: 过度想给人留下好印象；用力过猛地取悦或炫耀（常显得不自然或过头）

examples.en: He overimpressed the interviewer by listing every award he had ever won.
examples.zh: 他为了给面试官留下深刻印象，把自己得过的所有奖项都一股脑儿列了出来。

examples.en: Don’t overimpress—just speak clearly and be yourself.
examples.zh: 别用力过猛，清楚表达、做自己就好。

extraExplanation: “over-”有“过度、太……”的意思，所以 overimpress 带有负面语气：不是单纯“impress（打动）”，而是“为了显得厉害而显得刻意”。
在正式写作里更常见的是 “try too hard to impress” 或 “overdo it”；overimpress 偏口语/非正式，用于评价某人表现得太刻意。

summary.en: Overimpressed means too impressed, often in an exaggerated way.
summary.zh: overimpressed 指“过于钦佩/过度被打动”，常暗示反应夸张。

definition.en: Too impressed; feeling more admiration or excitement than the situation deserves (often suggesting the reaction is exaggerated or not very sincere).
definition.zh: 过于钦佩的；印象好得过头（常带有“反应夸张/不太真诚”的含义）。

examples.en: The interviewer seemed overimpressed by his title but didn’t ask about his real skills.
examples.zh: 面试官似乎对他的头衔过于钦佩，却没有问到他的真实能力。

examples.en: She was overimpressed with the expensive restaurant, even though the food was just okay.
examples.zh: 她对那家昂贵的餐厅印象好得过头，尽管食物其实只是一般。

examples.en: Don’t be overimpressed by fancy words—look at the facts.
examples.zh: 别被华丽的辞藻迷住了——看事实。

extraExplanation: “overimpressed”更常写作带连字符的“over-impressed”。在日常英语里也常用更口语的表达，比如“too impressed”或“overly impressed”。
语气上通常带一点批评或提醒：强调“被表面现象迷住了”“赞叹超过应有程度”。

summary.en: “Overimpresses” means “impresses too much” (and in printing, “presses too deeply”).
summary.zh: “overimpresses”表示「使人過度印象深刻／過度被打動」（印刷上也可指「壓印過深」）。

definition.en: to impress someone too much, or to make a stronger effect than is appropriate
definition.zh: （對某人）留下過於強烈的印象；使人過度被打動（強到不太合適）

examples.en: He overimpresses clients with technical details instead of focusing on their real needs.
examples.zh: 他用一堆技術細節去過度震撼客戶，反而沒有聚焦在對方真正的需求。

examples.en: The scary story overimpresses younger children and can make them anxious at night.
examples.zh: 那個恐怖故事會讓年紀較小的孩子受到過度影響，晚上容易焦慮。

definition.en: (printing) to press too hard so the design or letters sink too deeply into the paper
definition.zh: （印刷）壓印過深；壓得太重，讓圖案或字母在紙上陷得太深

examples.en: If the press overimpresses the paper, the text may look uneven or leave marks on the back.
examples.zh: 如果印刷機壓印過深，文字可能看起來不均勻，背面也可能出現壓痕。

synonyms: make too strong an impression on
extraExplanation: “overimpresses”是動詞 overimpress 的第三人稱單數現在式（he/she/it overimpresses）。日常會更常看到 “impresses” 或 “overwhelms”；“overimpress”相對較少用，語感偏正式或書面。
在心理學／教育語境中，overimpress 有時指「某種印象或觀念在心中被強烈烙印」，強到可能造成不必要的影響（例如恐懼、偏見）。

summary.en: Overimpressibility means being too easily impressed or influenced.
summary.zh: overimpressibility 指“过度易受影响、太容易被打动或被震住”的特质。

definition.en: the quality of being too easily impressed, influenced, or awed by people, ideas, or appearances
definition.zh: 过度易受影响；太容易被打动/被震住（的人格特质）

examples.en: His overimpressibility made him believe every confident speaker he heard.
examples.zh: 他太容易被有自信的演讲者打动，以至于听谁说得像样就信谁。

examples.en: Advertisements often target overimpressibility by using celebrity images and dramatic music.
examples.zh: 广告常用名人形象和煽情音乐来利用人们“过度易受影响”的心理。

examples.en: With experience, she learned to balance curiosity with less overimpressibility.
examples.zh: 随着阅历增长，她学会在保持好奇的同时，不再那么容易被影响。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较少见、偏书面/评论性的名词，多用于批评某人“太容易被表象或话术影响”。
构词上可理解为 over-（过度）+ impressible（易受影响的、易被打动的）+ -ity（名词后缀），意思接近“过度轻信/过度易感”。在日常口语里更常用：gullibility（轻信）、credulity（轻信）、being easily impressed（很容易被打动）。

summary.en: An uncommon adjective meaning “extremely impressionable; too easily influenced.”
summary.zh: 一个较少见的形容词，意思是“非常易受影响的；过于容易被打动或说服的”。

definition.en: Too easily influenced, affected, or convinced; extremely impressionable.
definition.zh: 过于容易受影响的；极易被打动或被说服的；非常易受暗示的。

examples.en: As a teenager, she was overimpressible and often copied whatever her friends liked.
examples.zh: 她十几岁时非常易受影响，朋友喜欢什么她常常就跟着喜欢什么。

examples.en: The coach warned the team not to be overimpressible when they saw the other side’s flashy warm-up.
examples.zh: 教练提醒队员别太容易被对方花哨的热身动作唬住。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，更多时候英语会用更常见的 impressionable（易受影响的）或 gullible（轻信的）。over- 表示“过度、太……”，impressible 来自 impress（使产生印象/影响），合起来就是“过分容易被影响”。
语气上常带一点批评或担忧：强调某人（尤其是年轻人）对外界影响缺乏抵抗力。

summary.en: “Overimpressibly” is a rare adverb meaning “too easily influenced or affected.”
summary.zh: “overimpressibly”是一个罕见副词，意思是“过度容易受影响/被左右”。

definition.en: (Rare) In an overly impressionable way; too easily influenced or affected by what you see, hear, or experience.
definition.zh: （罕见）以过度容易受影响的方式；太容易被所见所闻或经历打动、左右。

examples.en: He reacted overimpressibly to every dramatic headline and changed his opinion overnight.
examples.zh: 他对每条耸动的标题都过度容易受影响，常常一夜之间就改变看法。

examples.en: As a new traveler, she listened overimpressibly to strangers’ stories and believed them too quickly.
examples.zh: 作为新手旅行者，她对陌生人的故事过度轻信，很快就相信了。

extraExplanation: “overimpressibly”不是常见标准词汇，实际写作中更常用的表达是“overly impressionable / too impressionable / easily influenced”。它的构词思路是 over-（过度）+ impressible（易受影响的）+ -ly（副词）。
“impressible”本身也偏书面和少见；日常英语里通常用“impressionable”（更常见）来表示“易受影响的”。因此，如果你的目标是自然地表达，优先选用“overly impressionable”或“too impressionable”。

summary.en: Overimpressing means either trying too hard to impress people, or (in printing/graphics) superimposing one element over another.
summary.zh: Overimpressing 指（1）为了给人好印象而用力过猛、刻意炫耀；或（2）（印刷/图像中）将元素叠印、叠加在另一元素上。

definition.en: Trying too hard to impress someone, often in a way that feels unnatural or shows off too much.
definition.zh: （为给人留下好印象而）用力过猛、刻意炫耀，往往显得不自然。

examples.en: He kept name-dropping famous people, and it felt like overimpressing.
examples.zh: 他一直提某些名人来抬高自己，感觉就是在刻意炫耀、用力过猛。

examples.en: Overimpressing in an interview can make you seem less sincere.
examples.zh: 面试时如果用力过猛地想表现，反而会显得不够真诚。

definition.en: (Printing/graphics) Laying one image, pattern, or text over another; superimposing.
definition.zh: （印刷/图像）把一个图像、图案或文字叠印在另一个上面；叠加印刷。

examples.en: The designer is overimpressing the logo on a textured background.
examples.zh: 设计师正在把标志叠印到有纹理的背景上。

examples.en: Overimpressing black text on a dark photo can reduce readability.
examples.zh: 把黑色文字叠印在较暗的照片上会降低可读性。

extraExplanation: “overimpressing”常见于口语或写作中描述社交场合的“用力过猛”，语气通常带一点负面评价，接近“trying too hard”“showing off”。
印刷/设计语境里的 overimpress 是较专业的用法，含义更中性，类似“superimpose（叠加）/overprint（套印、叠印）”。

summary.en: Overimpressionability means being too easily influenced or affected.
summary.zh: overimpressionability 指「過度容易受影響／太易被左右」。

definition.en: The tendency to be too easily influenced by other people, events, or emotions; being overly impressionable.
definition.zh: 過度易受影響的傾向；太容易被他人、事件或情緒左右。

examples.en: Her overimpressionability made it hard for her to ignore negative comments online.
examples.zh: 她的過度易受影響讓她很難忽視網路上的負面評論。

examples.en: Teachers try to protect younger students from overimpressionability by encouraging critical thinking.
examples.zh: 老師會透過培養批判思考來保護年幼學生，避免他們過度易受影響。

extraExplanation: 這個字非常少見，多數情況下英文更常用「over-sensitivity」「being too impressionable」或「excessive impressionability」。
字形可拆成 over-（過度）+ impression（印象／影響）+ -able（容易…的）+ -ity（名詞化），字面意思就是「過度容易留下印象／被影響的性質」。

summary.en: Overimpressionable means excessively easy to influence.
summary.zh: overimpressionable 指“过于容易受影响的”。

definition.en: Too easily influenced, especially by other people’s opinions, emotions, or suggestions; excessively impressionable.
definition.zh: 过于容易受影响的；特别容易被他人的观点、情绪或暗示左右的。

examples.en: Teenagers can be overimpressionable, so role models matter a lot.
examples.zh: 青少年可能过于容易受影响，所以榜样非常重要。

examples.en: He was overimpressionable in meetings and often changed his mind after hearing confident speakers.
examples.zh: 他在会议中很容易被影响，常常听到自信的发言者就改变想法。

examples.en: Try not to make big decisions when you feel overimpressionable and emotionally overwhelmed.
examples.zh: 当你觉得自己过于容易受影响、情绪又很崩溃时，尽量不要做重大决定。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、太……”，所以 overimpressionable 的语气通常带有提醒或轻微批评：不是普通的 impressionable（容易受影响），而是“过头了”。
这个词在日常英语里不算常见；更常用的说法是 “too impressionable” 或 “highly impressionable”。在正式写作中也可以用 “overly impressionable”。

summary.en: “Overimpressionableness” is a rare/nonstandard noun meaning excessive impressionability—being too easily influenced.
summary.zh: “overimpressionableness”是罕见/非标准名词，意思是“过度易受影响性”，即太容易被他人左右。

definition.en: (Rare / nonstandard) the quality of being too easily influenced by other people’s opinions, emotions, or appearances; excessive impressionability.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）过度容易受他人观点、情绪或表象影响的特质；过度易受影响性。

examples.en: Her overimpressionableness made her change her mind every time someone spoke confidently.
examples.zh: 她的“过度易受影响”让她只要听到别人说得很自信就会改变主意。

examples.en: In a stressful environment, overimpressionableness can lead to impulsive decisions.
examples.zh: 在压力环境中，过度易受影响可能导致冲动的决定。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语中非常少见，很多词典不会收录；写作和口语里更常用的表达是：over-impressionability（过度易受影响性）、being overly impressionable（太容易受影响）、excessive impressionability（过度的易受影响）。
构词上可以理解为 over-（过度）+ impressionable（易受影响的）+ -ness（名词后缀）。如果你是在正式写作里使用，建议改用更常见的表达以避免读者觉得不自然。

summary.en: “Overimpressionably” means ‘in an overly impressionable, too-easily-influenced way’ (rare/nonstandard).
summary.zh: “overimpressionably”指“以过度易受影响、太容易被左右的方式”（非常少见/不太标准）。

definition.en: In a way that is too easily influenced or affected by what one sees, hears, or experiences.
definition.zh: 以（过于）容易受影响、受感染的方式；太容易被所见所闻左右地。

examples.en: He reacted overimpressionably to every comment online and took small criticisms personally.
examples.zh: 他对网上每条评论都过于敏感、容易受影响，把小小的批评也当成针对自己。

examples.en: As a child, she listened overimpressionably and copied the adults’ opinions without questioning them.
examples.zh: 小时候她听什么都很容易受影响，不加思考就照搬大人的看法。

extraExplanation: “overimpressionably”非常少见，很多词典不收录；更常见、更自然的表达是用短语：“in an overly impressionable way / too easily influenced”。
它来自形容词“impressionable（易受影响的）”，加上前缀“over-（过度）”表示“太……”，再变成副词“-ly”。在正式写作中建议优先用更常见的替代说法。

summary.en: Overinclinable means “too inclined” or “excessively willing/prone” to do something.
summary.zh: overinclinable 表示“过于倾向/过于愿意”，指对某事的倾向或习惯有些过头。

definition.en: Too willing or ready to do something; excessively inclined or disposed toward a particular action or attitude.
definition.zh: 过于愿意/倾向于做某事的；（对某种行为或态度）倾向过度的。

examples.en: He’s overinclinable to apologize, even when he hasn’t done anything wrong.
examples.zh: 他太容易道歉了，即使并没有做错什么。

examples.en: The manager was overinclinable to micromanage, which frustrated the team.
examples.zh: 这位经理过于倾向于事无巨细地管控，让团队很沮丧。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较少见的形容词，由 over-（“过度”）+ inclinable（“容易倾向于……”）组成。日常英语里更常用的表达是 overly inclined to… / too ready to… / prone to… 。
常见搭配是 overinclinable to + 动词原形（to do…），用来轻微批评某种“过头的”习惯或倾向。

summary.en: Overinclination means an excessive or overly strong tendency or preference.
summary.zh: overinclination 指“过度的倾向/过强的偏好”。

definition.en: an excessive tendency or too-strong preference toward something; being more inclined than is reasonable or balanced
definition.zh: 过度的倾向；过强的偏好（超过合理或平衡的程度）

examples.en: His overinclination to please everyone made it hard for him to say no.
examples.zh: 他过度想讨好所有人的倾向，让他很难拒绝别人。

examples.en: An overinclination toward speed can create safety risks on the road.
examples.zh: 对速度的过度偏好可能会在路上造成安全风险。

extraExplanation: “overinclination”由 over-（过度）+ inclination（倾向、偏好）构成，语气通常带有“超过适当程度”的批评或提醒意味。日常英语里更常见的表达是“an excessive tendency to…”、“a strong bias toward…/a predisposition to…”。

summary.en: Overincline means to incline too much (or be too steep), and it can also mean setting an exercise machine to an overly steep incline.
summary.zh: Overincline 表示“过度倾斜/太陡”，也可指（健身中）把器械坡度调得过陡。

definition.en: to lean or slope too much; to tilt beyond the desired or safe angle
definition.zh: 过度倾斜；倾斜过头（超过理想或安全角度）

examples.en: If you overincline the ladder, it may slip and fall.
examples.zh: 如果梯子过度倾斜，可能会打滑倒下。

examples.en: The road overinclines on that curve, so drivers should slow down.
examples.zh: 那段弯道路面倾斜过头，所以司机应该减速。

definition.en: (fitness) to set a treadmill or machine to an excessively steep incline
definition.zh: （健身）把跑步机或器械坡度调得过陡

examples.en: Don’t overincline the treadmill if you’re new to hill training.
examples.zh: 如果你刚开始练爬坡训练，就别把跑步机坡度调得过陡。

examples.en: I overinclined it and my calves felt sore the next day.
examples.zh: 我把坡度调过头了，第二天小腿很酸。

definition.en: excessively inclined; too steep or tilted
definition.zh: 过度倾斜的；过陡的

examples.en: An overincline surface can be unsafe for wheelchairs.
examples.zh: 过度倾斜的地面可能对轮椅使用者不安全。

examples.en: They rebuilt the ramp because the old one was overincline.
examples.zh: 他们重建了坡道，因为旧坡道太陡了。

extraExplanation: “overincline”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的表达是“tilt too much / incline too much / be too steep”。在健身语境中，人们也可能写成“over-incline”（加连字符）来强调“调得过头”。

summary.en: Overinclined means excessively inclined or too willing/likely to do something.
summary.zh: overinclined 指“过于倾向于”或“太愿意/太容易做某事”。

definition.en: Too willing or too likely to do something; having an excessive tendency or preference.
definition.zh: 过于倾向于（做某事）；过分偏好；太容易（做某事）。

examples.en: He’s overinclined to say yes to every request, even when he’s exhausted.
examples.zh: 他太容易对每个请求都答应了，即使他已经筋疲力尽。

examples.en: Some people are overinclined to blame themselves for problems they didn’t cause.
examples.zh: 有些人会过于倾向于把并非自己造成的问题归咎于自己。

examples.en: I’m overinclined to avoid conflict, so I don’t always speak up.
examples.zh: 我太倾向于回避冲突，所以并不总是敢表达意见。

extraExplanation: “over-” 是常见前缀，表示“过度、过分”。因此 overinclined 强调“倾向”本身没有错，但程度太强，常带轻微负面含义。日常写作中也常用更简单的表达，如 “too inclined to…” 或 “prone to…”。

summary.en: Overinclines means “tilts/leans too much” (literal) or “is too strongly inclined toward something” (figurative).
summary.zh: overinclines表示“倾斜过度”（字面）或“过度偏向某事/某种观点”（比喻）。

definition.en: (often technical) To tilt or slope too much; to make something lean beyond the desired or safe angle.
definition.zh: （常用于技术语境）使倾斜过度；（或）倾斜得超过理想/安全角度。

examples.en: If the road overinclines on the curve, cars may skid in wet weather.
examples.zh: 如果弯道的路面外倾过度，潮湿天气里车辆可能会打滑。

examples.en: The chair legs were uneven, so the seat overinclined to one side.
examples.zh: 椅子腿不平，所以座面向一侧过度倾斜。

definition.en: (figurative) To be too strongly disposed toward something; to lean too much toward an opinion or choice.
definition.zh: （比喻）过于偏向某事；在观点或选择上倾向过度。

examples.en: He overinclines toward pessimism when he’s under stress.
examples.zh: 他一有压力就会过度偏向悲观。

examples.en: Try not to overincline to one explanation before you check the facts.
examples.zh: 在核实事实之前，尽量不要过度偏向某一种解释。

extraExplanation: “overinclines”通常是动词“overincline”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it overinclines）。这个词在日常口语中不算常见，更常见的表达有“tilt too much / lean too far / be too biased toward”。
构词上：over-（过度）+ incline（倾斜/倾向）。理解前缀over-有助于掌握类似词：overreact（反应过度）、overestimate（高估）。

summary.en: “Overinclining” means leaning too much—either physically (too steep/tilted) or figuratively (too biased toward something).
summary.zh: “overinclining”指“过度倾斜”，既可指身体/物体角度过大，也可指立场或判断上过分偏向某一方。

definition.en: leaning or tilting too much; becoming more slanted than is safe, stable, or intended.
definition.zh: 过度倾斜；比安全、稳定或预期更斜。

examples.en: The ladder was overinclining, so she moved it closer to the wall.
examples.zh: 梯子在过度倾斜，所以她把它往墙边挪近了一点。

examples.en: If the bike is overinclining on a turn, you may lose traction.
examples.zh: 如果自行车转弯时过度倾斜，可能会失去抓地力。

definition.en: showing an excessive tendency or bias toward something (an opinion, choice, or behavior).
definition.zh: 过分偏向（某种观点、选择或行为）；倾向过度。

examples.en: He worried he was overinclining toward pessimism after the bad news.
examples.zh: 听到坏消息后，他担心自己过分偏向悲观。

examples.en: The committee was overinclining toward one candidate without reviewing all the evidence.
examples.zh: 委员会在未审查全部证据前就过分偏向某一位候选人。

extraExplanation: “overinclining”是动词“overincline”的现在分词/动名词形式，整体用法比较少见，更常见的表达是“leaning too far / tilting too much / overly inclined”。
在工程、运动或安全语境中，它多指物体或身体姿态“倾斜过度”；在抽象语境中则可指“在立场或判断上偏得太多”。

summary.en: Overinclusive means “too broad”: it includes more cases or people than necessary, often causing unfairness or inaccuracy.
summary.zh: Overinclusive 意为“范围过大/过于宽泛”：把不该包含的情况或人也算进去，常导致不公平或不准确。

definition.en: Including more people, things, or cases than is necessary or intended (often in a way that becomes unfair, inaccurate, or inefficient).
definition.zh: 把不需要或不该包含的对象也算进去；范围过大（常导致不公平、不准确或低效率）。

examples.en: The new policy is overinclusive because it punishes students who didn’t break the rule.
examples.zh: 这项新政策范围过大，因为它惩罚了那些并没有违规的学生。

examples.en: His definition of “spam” was so overinclusive that it included normal newsletters.
examples.zh: 他对“垃圾邮件”的定义太宽泛了，连正常的邮件简报也被算进去了。

examples.en: An overinclusive search filter can hide useful results.
examples.zh: 过于“广撒网”的搜索筛选条件可能会把有用的结果也隐藏掉。

definition.en: (Of a rule, law, or argument) Broader than necessary so that it covers cases it shouldn’t, even if it also covers the intended cases.
definition.zh: （指规则、法律或论证）比需要的更宽，因此在覆盖目标情形的同时，也覆盖了不该覆盖的情形。

examples.en: The court said the ban was overinclusive because it restricted harmless speech.
examples.zh: 法院认为这项禁令“过于宽泛”，因为它限制了无害的言论。

examples.en: This argument is overinclusive: it explains too much and loses precision.
examples.zh: 这个论证过于宽泛：它解释得太多，反而失去了精确性。

extraExplanation: “overinclusive”常见于法律、政策与逻辑讨论，尤其用来批评某项规定“打击面过宽”，把本不该被限制/处罚的人或行为也纳入范围。
它常与“underinclusive（范围过窄，漏掉该包含的对象）”对比使用：overinclusive强调“多抓了”，underinclusive强调“漏抓了”。

summary.en: Overincrust means to cover something with an excessive crust or hard deposit.
summary.zh: overincrust 指让某物被过度的硬壳或沉积物覆盖（过度结垢/结壳）。

definition.en: to cover (something) with a thick layer or crust; to encrust too much or excessively
definition.zh: 使（某物）覆盖上一层很厚的硬壳/结垢；过度结壳、过度结垢

examples.en: Mineral-rich water can overincrust pipes with scale over time.
examples.zh: 含矿物质丰富的水久而久之会让管道过度结垢。

examples.en: If you cook it too long, the sauce may overincrust the pan and become hard to clean.
examples.zh: 如果煮太久，酱汁可能会在锅上过度结壳，变得很难清洗。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、偏书面或技术语境的词：over-（过度）+ incrust（使结壳/结垢）。日常英语里更常说 encrust / build up / form a crust（结壳、堆积、形成硬壳）。
常见使用场景多与“水垢、矿物沉积、锈蚀、油污结硬”等有关，例如：pipes overincrusted with scale（被水垢严重覆盖的管道）。

summary.en: “Overincurious” means excessively curious (not a common standard word; often better as “overcurious” or “overly inquisitive”).
summary.zh: “overincurious”指“过度好奇/过分爱打听”，但不算常见标准用词，更常写作 overcurious 或 overly inquisitive。

definition.en: Excessively curious; asking too many questions or wanting to know more than is appropriate in a situation.
definition.zh: 过度好奇的；爱打听太多、超出场合分寸的。

examples.en: He wasn’t trying to be rude—he was just overincurious about her personal life.
examples.zh: 他并不是故意无礼——只是对她的私生活过度好奇。

examples.en: The reporter sounded overincurious, pushing for details the family didn’t want to share.
examples.zh: 那位记者听起来过于爱刨根问底，追问家属不想公开的细节。

extraExplanation: “overincurious”并不是常见的标准英语词汇，更常见的表达是 **overcurious**（过度好奇）或 **overly inquisitive**（过分爱打听）。在写作中如果使用“overincurious”，读者可能会觉得是拼写错误或个人造词。
词根提示：**inquisitive** 表示“好奇、爱提问的”，加上 **overly/too** 更自然：*too inquisitive / overly inquisitive*。

summary.en: Overindebted means owing so much money that repayment is hard or unrealistic.
summary.zh: overindebted 指负债过多，债务高到难以或不现实地偿还。

definition.en: Having borrowed so much money that it is difficult or impossible to repay; owing more than you can reasonably afford.
definition.zh: 负债过多的；借债太多以至于很难或无法偿还；债务超过自身可承受范围。

examples.en: Many households became overindebted after using credit cards for everyday expenses.
examples.zh: 许多家庭在用信用卡支付日常开销后变得负债过多。

examples.en: The report warns that overindebted borrowers are more likely to miss payments.
examples.zh: 报告警告说，负债过多的借款人更可能出现逾期还款。

examples.en: She took a second job to avoid becoming overindebted.
examples.zh: 她做了第二份工作，以避免陷入负债过多的状态。

extraExplanation: 常见使用场景：个人理财、消费信贷、房贷/车贷、以及宏观经济讨论中。它强调的是“债务负担过重”而不仅仅是“有债务”。
相关搭配：overindebted consumers/households/borrowers（负债过多的消费者/家庭/借款人）；become/turn overindebted（变得负债过多）；overindebtedness（名词：负债过度）。
语义对比：in debt 只是“有债”，debt-ridden 更强调“被债务困扰”，而 overindebted 更强调“超过可承受或可持续的程度”。

summary.en: Overindividualism means excessive individualism that undermines community and cooperation.
summary.zh: overindividualism 指“过度个人主义”，强调个人至上而削弱共同体与合作。

definition.en: An extreme focus on personal independence, self-interest, and personal rights in a way that weakens care for others, community responsibility, or cooperation.
definition.zh: 过度个人主义：把个人独立、个人利益与个人权利看得过重，以至于削弱了对他人、共同体责任或合作的重视。

examples.en: Some critics argue that overindividualism can make it harder to build trust in a community.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为，过度个人主义会让建立社区信任变得更困难。

examples.en: Overindividualism may lead people to see every problem as “not my responsibility.”
examples.zh: 过度个人主义可能会让人把每个问题都当作“与我无关”。

examples.en: In team projects, overindividualism can reduce collaboration and shared problem-solving.
examples.zh: 在团队项目中，过度个人主义会减少合作与共同解决问题的意愿。

extraExplanation: 这个词常用于社会学、文化评论或公共议题讨论中，带有批评色彩：不是反对“个人主义”本身，而是强调“过度”之后对公共利益、互助精神、社会凝聚力的伤害。
在英语语境里，它常与“community-mindedness（社区意识）”“collective responsibility（集体/共同责任）”“social cohesion（社会凝聚力）”等概念对比使用。

summary.en: Overindividualistic means excessively individualistic—too focused on the self rather than the group.
summary.zh: overindividualistic 指“过度个人主义的”，过分以自我为中心而忽视群体与合作。

definition.en: Too focused on personal goals, rights, or independence, often at the expense of community, cooperation, or shared responsibility.
definition.zh: 过度个人主义的；过分强调个人目标、权利或独立，常以牺牲群体合作与共同责任为代价。

examples.en: Some critics say the workplace has become overindividualistic, rewarding lone stars more than teamwork.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为职场变得过度个人主义，更奖励“个人明星”而不是团队合作。

examples.en: His overindividualistic attitude made it hard for him to accept feedback or compromise.
examples.zh: 他过度个人主义的态度让他很难接受反馈或作出妥协。

extraExplanation: “overindividualistic”常用于社会评论或文化讨论，带有批评或担忧的语气（不只是描述“很独立”）。
它与“independent（独立的）”不同：independent多为中性或褒义；overindividualistic强调“过度”，暗示对关系、公共利益或合作产生负面影响。
常见搭配：an overindividualistic culture/society（过度个人主义的文化/社会），an overindividualistic mindset（过度个人主义的心态）。

summary.en: “Overindividualistically” means “in an excessively individualistic way.”
summary.zh: “overindividualistically”意为“以过度个人主义的方式”。

definition.en: In an excessively individualistic way; emphasizing personal independence, choice, or self-interest too much, often at the expense of community, cooperation, or shared responsibility.
definition.zh: 以过度个人主义的方式；过分强调个人独立、个人选择或个人利益，常常牺牲社群、合作或共同责任。

examples.en: The policy was criticized for being framed overindividualistically, ignoring how families and communities actually function.
examples.zh: 这项政策被批评为以过度个人主义的角度来制定，忽视了家庭与社区的真实运作方式。

examples.en: If you approach teamwork overindividualistically, you may struggle to share credit and listen to others.
examples.zh: 如果你以过度个人主义的方式看待团队合作，你可能会难以分享功劳并倾听他人。

examples.en: The essay argues that we have been taught to think overindividualistically about success.
examples.zh: 这篇文章认为，我们被教育以过度个人主义的方式理解“成功”。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常口语中很少见，更常见的表达是：“too individualistically / overly individualistic(ally) / in an overly individualistic way”。
构词上是 over-（“过度”）+ individualistic（“个人主义的”）+ -ally（副词后缀）。因为很长、很书面，常出现在学术写作或社会评论里（例如讨论文化、政策、教育、社会价值观）。

summary.en: Overindividualization is treating a situation as too uniquely personal and ignoring general patterns or evidence.
summary.zh: overindividualization 指把情况看得过于“独一无二”，从而忽视一般规律或证据。

definition.en: The tendency to treat a person, case, or problem as completely unique and separate from general patterns, categories, or evidence—often leading to decisions based more on personal details than on what usually works.
definition.zh: 把某个人、案例或问题看得“过于独特”，忽视一般规律、分类或证据的倾向——常导致决策过分依赖个人细节，而不参考通常有效的方法。

examples.en: In medicine, overindividualization can make a doctor ignore standard guidelines that help most patients.
examples.zh: 在医疗中，过度个体化可能让医生忽视对大多数患者都有帮助的标准指南。

examples.en: The policy failed because of overindividualization: every case was treated as exceptional, so no consistent rules were applied.
examples.zh: 这项政策失败是因为过度个体化：每个案例都被当成例外，结果无法执行一致的规则。

examples.en: Good teaching balances personal attention with shared learning goals; too much overindividualization can confuse students.
examples.zh: 好的教学会在个别关注与共同学习目标之间取得平衡；过度个体化可能让学生感到困惑。

extraExplanation: “overindividualization”常见于心理学、教育、管理与政策讨论，带有批评意味：提醒人们不要只看“特殊性”，还要参考统计规律、研究证据或可复制的方法。
它并不等于“尊重个体差异”。尊重差异通常是积极的；而“过度个体化”强调的是偏离常规到影响判断质量（例如忽略风险、忽略对多数人有效的方案）。

summary.en: Overindulge means to enjoy or consume something too much, especially food or drink.
summary.zh: overindulge 指过度享受或过量摄入，尤指食物或酒精。

definition.en: to have or do something (especially food, drink, or pleasure) too much; to indulge excessively
definition.zh: 过度享受；过量（尤指饮食、饮酒或娱乐）

examples.en: I overindulged at the buffet and felt sick afterward.
examples.zh: 我在自助餐吃得太多，之后觉得不舒服。

examples.en: During the holidays, it’s easy to overindulge in sweets.
examples.zh: 节日期间很容易甜食吃过量。

examples.en: He tries not to overindulge, even when celebrating.
examples.zh: 即使在庆祝时，他也尽量不过度放纵。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、超过正常程度”。因此 overindulge 语气通常带有“对身体或生活不太好”的提醒意味。
常见搭配：overindulge in food/alcohol/sweets（在……上过量）。在更广义场景也可指“过度沉迷于享乐或消费”，如 overindulge in shopping（购物过度）。

summary.en: “Overindulged” means having too much of something pleasurable, or being too lenient/giving—more than is healthy or appropriate.
summary.zh: “overindulged”指享受或放纵过头（吃喝、消费等过量），也可指对孩子等过度纵容。

definition.en: Allowed yourself or someone else to have too much of something enjoyable (food, drink, shopping, screen time, etc.); indulged to an unhealthy or excessive degree.
definition.zh: （自己或让别人）过度放纵；享受过头（如吃喝、购物、玩手机等），达到不健康或过量的程度。

examples.en: I overindulged at the buffet and felt sick afterward.
examples.zh: 我在自助餐吃得太多，后来觉得不舒服。

examples.en: After a stressful week, she overindulged in online shopping.
examples.zh: 压力很大的一周之后，她在网购上放纵过头了。

examples.en: He overindulged his kids, so they expected gifts all the time.
examples.zh: 他太宠孩子，结果孩子总是期待随时都有礼物。

definition.en: Past tense / past participle of “overindulge”: to eat, drink, spend, or enjoy something too much.
definition.zh: “overindulge”的过去式/过去分词：过度沉溺；吃喝过量；过度消费或享乐。

examples.en: We overindulged during the holidays.
examples.zh: 我们在假期里放纵过头了。

examples.en: He had overindulged in desserts, so he skipped dinner.
examples.zh: 他甜点吃太多了，所以晚饭就没吃。

extraExplanation: “overindulge”比“indulge”更强调“过头了/不合适了”，常带轻微批评或后悔的语气。
常见搭配：overindulge in food/alcohol/sweets/shopping；overindulge yourself（让自己放纵过头）；overindulge your children（过度溺爱孩子）。
语域上较常用于健康、消费、育儿等话题；比口语“pig out（大吃特吃）”更正式一些。

summary.en: Overindulgence means enjoying or consuming too much of something, often to an unhealthy or unwise degree.
summary.zh: Overindulgence 指对某事物过度享用或放纵，程度通常不健康或不明智。

definition.en: the act of having or doing too much of something (especially food, drink, or pleasure), often in a way that is unhealthy or unwise
definition.zh: 过度放纵；过量享用（尤指饮食、饮酒或享乐，通常不健康或不明智）

examples.en: Overindulgence in sweets can lead to tooth problems.
examples.zh: 过度吃甜食可能会导致牙齿问题。

examples.en: After the holidays, she tried to recover from weeks of overindulgence.
examples.zh: 假期过后，她试着从几周的过度放纵中恢复过来。

examples.en: He blamed his tiredness on overindulgence the night before.
examples.zh: 他把疲劳归咎于前一晚的过度纵酒/放纵。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：over- 表示“过度”，indulgence 表示“放纵/纵容”。合起来就是“超过适度的享受或放纵”。
语体与语气：overindulgence 常用于较正式或带警示意味的表达（健康、饮食、生活方式建议等），比 too much 更书面，也常带“后果不佳”的暗示。
常见搭配：overindulgence in alcohol/food/sweets；a night of overindulgence；warn against overindulgence。

summary.en: Overindulgent means excessively allowing pleasure or comfort, often in a way seen as lacking self-control.
summary.zh: Overindulgent 指“过度放纵/过度沉溺”，常带批评意味，强调缺乏节制。

definition.en: Allowing yourself (or someone else) to have too much of something enjoyable, especially food, drink, comfort, or pleasure; excessive in treating or satisfying desires.
definition.zh: 过度放纵的；（对食物、饮酒、享受、舒适等）过分沉溺、过度满足欲望的。

examples.en: After a week of celebrations, he felt tired and guilty about being overindulgent with desserts.
examples.zh: 庆祝了一周后，他因为甜点吃得太放纵而感到疲惫和内疚。

examples.en: The review called the film overindulgent—beautiful to watch, but too long and self-satisfied.
examples.zh: 影评说这部电影“过度铺张自我沉溺”——画面很美，但太长、太自我满足。

examples.en: Some parents worry that being overindulgent can make children less grateful.
examples.zh: 一些家长担心过度溺爱会让孩子不那么懂得感恩。

extraExplanation: 词源上可理解为 over-（过度）+ indulgent（放纵的/纵容的）。“overindulgent”常带有评价色彩，暗示“享受过头、缺乏节制”。
在影评/文学评论里，overindulgent 还常用来形容作品“过度炫技或自我陶醉”，例如镜头、铺陈、情节长度等超过了必要程度。

summary.en: Overindulgently means “in an excessively indulgent way; too much.”
summary.zh: overindulgently 意为“以过度放纵的方式；太过头”。

definition.en: In an excessively indulgent way; too much, especially in eating, drinking, spending, or pleasure-seeking.
definition.zh: 以过度放纵的方式；太过头（尤指在饮食、饮酒、花钱或追求享乐方面）。

examples.en: He ate overindulgently during the holiday weekend and felt sick afterward.
examples.zh: 假期周末他吃得太放纵，之后感觉不舒服。

examples.en: The company spent overindulgently on luxury office furniture instead of investing in training.
examples.zh: 公司把钱过度花在豪华办公家具上，而不是投入员工培训。

examples.en: She laughed overindulgently at every joke, even the unfunny ones.
examples.zh: 她对每个笑话都笑得过于纵容，连不好笑的也一样。

extraExplanation: “overindulgently”来自动词 overindulge（过度放纵）+ 副词后缀 -ly。常见搭配：eat/drink overindulgently（吃/喝得过度）、spend overindulgently（花钱过度）。
语气通常带轻微批评或提醒：强调“超过适度、对自己（或他人）太纵容”。

summary.en: “Overindulges” means someone has or does too much of something enjoyable, or spoils someone by giving too much and setting too few limits.
summary.zh: “Overindulges”表示（某人）在享乐方面“过度”，或指对某人过分纵容、太宠。

definition.en: to do or have too much of something enjoyable (like food, shopping, or entertainment), often so it becomes unhealthy or unwise
definition.zh: 过度享受；过度放纵（如吃太多、买太多、玩得太多），以至于不健康或不明智

examples.en: He overindulges in sweets, so he’s trying to cut back.
examples.zh: 他甜食吃得太多，所以正在努力减少。

examples.en: On weekends, she sometimes overindulges and stays up too late watching shows.
examples.zh: 周末她有时会放纵一下，追剧熬夜到很晚。

examples.en: The company worried customers would overindulge if portions were too large.
examples.zh: 公司担心如果分量太大，顾客会吃得过量。

definition.en: to treat someone with too much kindness or too few limits (especially a child), which may lead to spoiled behavior
definition.zh: 对（某人）过度纵容；过分迁就（尤指孩子），可能导致被宠坏

examples.en: Some parents overindulge their children with gifts instead of setting rules.
examples.zh: 有些父母用送礼物来过度纵容孩子，而不是立规矩。

examples.en: His aunt overindulges him, so he expects special treatment.
examples.zh: 他姨妈太宠他了，所以他总觉得自己该被特殊对待。

extraExplanation: “overindulges”是动词“overindulge”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it overindulges）。常带一点负面含义：不是单纯“享受”，而是“过头了”。

summary.en: Overindulging means doing or consuming something enjoyable too much—more than is good for you.
summary.zh: overindulging 指对令人愉快的事物过度享受或过量摄取，超过对自己有益的程度。
